byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: Conservative wing of German government calls for ban on face veils worn by Muslim women in schools and universities and while driving; proposal reflects anxieties over absorbing immigrants and increased support for far right, and follows similar proposal to ban 'burkinis' in France.

headline.print_headline: Germany, Like France, Questions Place of Islamic Veils in Its Society
headline.main: Germany, Like France, Questions Place of Islamic Veils in Its Society

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel’s governing conservative bloc has raised the possibility of a ban on face veils in schools and universities and while driving....
lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel’s governing conservative bloc has raised the possibility of a ban on face veils in schools and universities and while driving.
